title: Körmend District
text:
Körmend () is a district in south-western part of <a href="Vas%20County">Vas County</a>. "<a href="K%C3%B6rmend">Körmend</a>" is also the name of the town where the district seat is found. The district is located in the <a href="Western%20Transdanubia">Western Transdanubia Statistical Region</a>.
Geography.
Körmend District borders with <a href="Szombathely%20District">Szombathely District</a> to the north, <a href="Vasv%C3%A1r%20District">Vasvár District</a> to the east, <a href="Zalaegerszeg%20District">Zalaegerszeg District</a> and <a href="Lenti%20District">Lenti District</a> "(<a href="Zala%20County">Zala County</a>)" to the south, <a href="Slovenia">Slovenia</a>, <a href="Szentgotth%C3%A1rd%20District">Szentgotthárd District</a> and the <a href="Austria">Austria</a>n state of <a href="Burgenland">Burgenland</a> to the west. The number of the inhabited places in Körmend District is 46.
Municipalities.
The district has 2 <a href="List%20of%20cities%20and%20towns%20of%20Hungary">towns</a> and 44 villages.
The bolded municipalities are cities.
Demographics.
In 2011, it had a population of 27,177 and the <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 44/km².
Ethnicity.
Besides the Hungarian majority, the main minorities are the German (approx. 300) and Roma (250).
Total population (2011 census): 27,177<br>
Ethnic groups (2011 census): Identified themselves: 24,347 persons:
Approx. 3,000 persons in Körmend District did not declare their ethnic group at the 2011 census.
